Cost Engineer,"Heerema Marine Contractors
Cost Engineer
Do you have what it takes to prepare cost estimates for tenders ?
Cost Engineering
Leiden
Master
Starter
A unique maritime adventure

At Heerema Marine Contractors, we do something new every day. We operate the world’s largest crane vessels and with them we transport, install, and remove offshore structures for the offshore energy markets. Our projects range from installing wind turbines, removing retired offshore oil and gas platforms, and installing platforms up to 50,000 metric tons. By joining us, you will play an important part in our unique maritime adventure.
Your role in the story

As Cost Engineer, you are responsible for the preparation of tender cost estimates. The complexity and size of the tenders combined with the number of stakeholders and time pressure will challenge you in this role.
Who will you work with?
Your team will consist of Diederik, Santiago and many others. You will work closely with the Tender Manager and Tender Coordinator. It will be your job to prepare cost estimates for complex tenders.
Daily activities:
You make sure that tender cost estimates are available within the required timeframe
Support Business development efforts
Maintain consistency between tender cost estimates and maintain existing and develop new cost models
Cost database management and maintenance
Cash flow and risk analyses.
Is this the job for you?
A minimum of a Higher Vocational or Bachelor degree in (Offshore) Engineering/Business or a related field
A minimum of 2 years of experience in (offshore) construction, marine contracting or another relevant field
Flexible attitude and thrive on deadlines
The ability to understand how our cost engineering software (Cleopatra) works and the capability to interface with the supplier on required maintenance or upgrades
Excellent communication skills, fluent in English both written and spoken
Experience with Cleopatra
Experience with cost estimating and/or project controlling is a plus
Experience with Java and/or Groovy language is a plus.
Here is what it takes to be a real Heerema colleague
Learning mindset, which means being open to feedback, curious, and eager to learn
Personal leadership which means you are an entrepreneur at heart, have the mindset of a founder and take control of your own work and development.
Working at Heerema Marine Contractors

Making the impossible possible offshore, this is what drives us at Heerema! To execute our offshore projects we must innovate, engineer and develop to find solutions for our clients’ challenges. We are passionate about sustainability and are guided by our Sustainability Roadmap to reduce our impact on the planet. Working with Heerema means working in an international, informal, and friendly environment where you will meet likeminded and passionate colleagues.
Here's why people love working with us
Working on challenging projects
Extensive onboarding process and opportunities to develop
A development program to allow your talents to flourish
Fun Friday-afternoon get together with colleagues
Excellent perks and benefits, including a personal performance bonus, travel allowance, and contributions to your pension and insurance
Free exercise facilities
A social safety net with committed colleagues around you
Plenty of digital and real-world activities to get to know colleagues outside your team
30 days off to fully recharge
A modern and easily accessible office in Leiden.
Is this your dream job? Put in your application now!

We are looking forward to hearing from you. We are interested in your CV, but we mainly want to find out more about your ambitions, your personality, and what is your motivation to succeed. So be sure to include a brief cover letter explaining why you are the perfect fit for this position.
So hit the button, apply, and make the impossible possible with Heerema. We’d love to meet you!
The application process

The application process will consist of an online assessment, two interviews and contract negotiations. At the end of the process, we will cordially welcome you aboard.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/655284/heerema-marine-contractors-squarelogo-1426660598609.png,Leiden,nan,Heerema Marine Contractors
Project Engineer,"Description

General information:As a result of dynamic growth of our organization we are currently looking for candidates for the position SCADA Project Engineer. Open-minded, customer oriented & innovative are key-factors for success in our working environment. You should be a team player who collaborates across organizational levels in an intercultural environment.Responsibilities:Build station control systems (SCADA) for high and medium voltage switchgears according to the newest technology standard IEC 61850. Integrate the systems including the parametrization of the Ethernet-based communication structure. Implement the project specific functions as well as software applications, take care of tests, and coordinate the interfaces. Support the project manager in technical matters and coordinate both customers and internal partners. Prepare operation manuals that are based on our customer's requirements. Support the local sales team in tendering phase of projects. Provide customer support by means of curative and preventive maintenance tasks. Living Hitachi energy's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.Your background:Degree in power engineering, electrical engineering or information technology. Experience in station automation, SCADA or process automation will be an asset. Knowledge of PC technology, in networks (LAN) and peripheral devices. Very good knowledge of MS Windows environment (MS Visio, MS Office). Strong communication skills. Work in an independent manner. Good knowledge of Dutch and English is required. Driving license min cat B.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/3507483/hitachi-abb-power-grids-squareLogo-1634136174704.png,Rotterdam,nan,Hitachi Energy The Netherlands B.V.
Tender Coordinator,"Organisation
Position
Tender Coordinator
Vacancy ref
Based in
Zoetermeer
Business area
Renewables
Contract type
Staff
Closing date
Vacancy information
WHAT IS THE ROLE?
Seaway7 is looking for a Tender Coordinator on a full time, staff basis, situated within our Zoetermeer office.
As a Tender Coordinator you will be responsible for the preparation of proposals in response to client ITT’s and RFI’s, including coordination with other departments as and when required.
WHAT WILL YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES INVOLVE?
Interpretation of client’s ITT documents to understand all aspects of the project
Liaise with other departments to prepare optimum and cost-effective solutions, in line with Company strategy and with a focus on risk & opportunities
Responsible for the day to day coordination of tender activities under supervision of Tender Manager
Coordinate tender deliverables and input from all functions for inclusion into the tender
Ensure adherence to the sales & marketing process during the tender phase
Assist the tender manager during negotiations with clients to clarify and follow- up the proposal submission
WHAT EXPERIENCE DOES THE ROLE REQUIRE?
Good knowledge of oral and written English
Sound communication skills, oral, written and electronic.
Degree in Engineering or Business/Commercial management
Good time management skills and ability to set and meet tight deadlines.
Seaway7 is a global leader in the delivery of fixed offshore wind projects, committed to contributing to an efficient and sustainable energy supply for the future.

We are headquartered in Oslo - Norway with five further main offices in Aberdeen – UK, Leer – Germany, Vejle - Denmark, Taipei - Taiwan and Zoetermeer - the Netherlands, and have a local presence in all key offshore wind regions around the world. We employ more than 500 people onshore, and have an offshore workforce of around 500.
Seaway7 is committed to creating a diverse workforce and offer excellent career opportunities, supporting you to develop your skills and aspirations.
#LI-JS2",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/15168/subsea-7-squarelogo-1432302919463.png,Zoetermeer,nan,Subsea 7
Operations Coordinator 1,"Operations Coordinator 1
Location:
Amsterdam, NL
Country/Region: NL
Job Area: Logistics
Business Unit: RP Logistics & Operations

Are you a motivated and business savvy talent with a passion for logistics, operations, data entry, analytics and continual improvement? Are you interested in an opportunity to collaborate and be an enabler for excellent daily terminal operations in a growing international environment?
We are looking for a permanent Operations Coordinator to join our committed and high performing regional operations, vendor settlement, logistics planning and terminal coordination team.

The team is responsible for sales, supply, vendor settlement, logistics planning & terminal coordination end-to-end activities and contributes together with all our stakeholders to enable the highest business impact and support to strategic objectives.
Your part in Neste’s journey

In your role you will work closely with trading, supply and/or sales managers, Operations Coordinators globally , Shipping Operations, Land Logistics Managers, Logistics Planners, Terminals and other internal and external stakeholders. Manage day to day operative matters in renewable, petroleum product and raw material deliveries. You will execute raw material operations associated with shipments by vessels, barges, trucks, rail and/or containers. This position requires accuracy in daily activities, passion for cooperation, problem solving, solution oriented mindset and working with numbers. One of the key targets in this role is to manage daily operations in your designated area and the related data entries to our systems, focusing on operational efficiency, executed in line with the commercial contracts, digitalization, and automation initiatives.

In your role you also act as a subject matter expert and help our organisation to build, from operations coordination perspective, seamless process, clear roles & responsibilities and tools for future non bulk excellence.
Our work combines accountability, cooperation, and the desire to develop and renew.
The main responsibilities in this role:

Responsibility for daily transaction data of supply shipments by vessel, barge, truck, rail and containers for Supply and/or Sales contracts, as well as other complexities of the operations role (for example
column2: STS operations, blending, optimization, transfers etc). The main purpose is to independently coordinate and manage daily operations and data transactions, as well as daily reconciliation between various system

column1: Responsible for operating and executing the commercial contracts in the most accurate and efficient manner for your assigned area

Working closely with relevant stakeholders to ensure the timely and correctness of the daily data for efficient supplier / customer reporting and invoicing. The role may also include tasks in the areas of sustainability documentation, quality tracking, internal and external reporting and also helping in other daily operational tasks
Solving different issues such as terminal, customer and supplier related matters promptly
Helping to find ways to improve and automate the processes as well as managing, analysing and reporting the transaction data
Keys to success in this role
The best combination of experiences, skills and background is:
Degree in business or similar studies or minimum 5 years of relevant experience

Experience and/or relevant understanding of oil industry and/or terminal operations workflow, experience with vessel, barge, truck, container and/or rail deliveries. Operating Renewable Diesel or fossil middle distillates is a strong asset
Hands on with different IT-systems
column2: experience with ERP systems (especially with SAP, TMS), knowledge of Google tools (GMail, Sheets, Slides, Docs) and MS Excel

column1: Fluent in English, both written and spoken, other languages are an asset
Strong technology, analytical and communication skills
Independent and energetic approach to work
Pays attention to details
column2: accuracy in daily operations is a must, the candidate also must enjoy working with numbers

column1: Behaviour according to company values in all situations and understanding common goals
Stress-resistant personality, self leading and good problem solving skills
Ability to effectively prioritise tasks to meet deadlines, which may require flexibility to work past normal business hours

This position requires excellent cooperation skills, ability to interact and work in an international environment (different cultures, values and time zones) as well as an open mind (attitude) towards work tasks and work environment
We also value
Understanding of chemical knowledge, operations workflow and efficient ways of carrying out daily duties

Our success is based on our people who are the driving force behind Neste’s transformation to become a global leader in renewable and circular solutions. The passion that we have for creating a healthier planet for our children is what makes us unique. We believe everyone is a leader and share a natural desire for collaboration. Our three values “We care, We have courage and We cooperate” are embedded in our everyday work. Working safely and responsibly at all times is essential to all of us.
If this resonates with you, we look forward to receiving your application.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/42576/nestle-oil-squarelogo-1427196621822.png,Amsterdam,nan,Neste

Stagiair(e) Bedrijfskunde,"De afdeling Engineering is verantwoordelijk voor ontwerp-, engineering- en bouwprojecten rondom nieuwbouw, modificaties, uitbreidingen en onderhoud van de UNL-verrijkingsinstallaties, aanverwante systemen en gebouwen en gebouw gebonden installaties. De design- en engineeringprocessen zijn verplicht tijdens de volledige levenscyclus van een project, vanaf de opstartfase van het project tot de uiteindelijke overdracht aan de afdeling Operations. In deze functie werk je samen met alle UNL faciliteiten, zoals de verrijkingsplanten, stabiele isotopen, het recyclingcentrum, cilinderverwerking, etc. Voor de afdeling Engineering zijn we op zoek naar een
Stagiaire Bedrijfskunde
Wat ga je doen?

Je gaat tijdens je stage aan de slag met het optimaliseren van de processen binnen onze afdeling engineering. Je kunt hierbij denken aan een analyse van de huidige processen, faalkosten, risico’s en kwaliteit. Aan de hand van je analyse bepaal je verbeterpunten en schrijf je een rapport met daarin jouw advies voor een procesoptimalisatie.
Wat vragen we?
Je bent bezig met de HBO opleiding Bedrijfskunde
Je bent nieuwsgierig en leergierig
Je hebt een frisse kijk op dingen
Je wilt de kennis die jij hebt opgedaan tijdens je opleiding graag delen met anderen.
We zijn op zoek naar die stagiair(e) die vol enthousiasme en met 100% inzet aan de slag gaan en het verschil wil maken.
Waar kom je te werken?

Urenco is de spil in een wereldwijd netwerk voor schone energieopwekking. Met ons product, verrijkt uranium, maken kerncentrales CO2-vrije elektriciteit voor 100 miljoen gezinnen, bedrijven en scholen. Urenco heeft zorg voor mens en milieu hoog in het vaandel staan. Onze mensen krijgen energie van hun werk en geven dat door aan anderen. Zij bepalen het succes van de organisatie. Wij doen er daarom alles aan om een diverse en inclusieve organisatie te zijn, waar iedereen zich welkom en gewaardeerd voelt. De huidige situatie in de wereld heeft geleid tot ontwikkelingen op de verrijkingsmarkt: kerncentrales zoeken naar leveringszekerheid en dat heeft geleid tot een grote toename in de vraag naar ons verrijkt uranium. Als onderdeel daarvan, zetten we in op capaciteitsuitbreiding, onder meer door twee nieuwe verrijkingshallen in Almelo. En daar kunnen we jouw kennis en ambitie goed bij gebruiken!
How to Apply
Voor meer informatie over de inhoud van deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Brendan McElroy, Manager Engineering, tel: 0546-548134.

Is je interesse gewekt? Dan nodigen we je uit om te solliciteren door je CV en motivatie te sturen naar [email protected]",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/385752/urenco-squarelogo-1571963173842.png,Netherlands,nan,Urenco
Strategy and Development Internship,"ACT

ACT is the world's leading provider of market-based sustainability solutions. Working at the center of the global energy transition, ACT helps organizations hit their climate action targets, no matter how ambitious. Since 2009, ACT has become a trusted brand in high-impact climate projects, renewable energy markets, energy efficiency, renewable fuels, and carbon credits. ACT delivers tailor-made solutions from offices in Amsterdam, New York, Singapore, Shanghai, and Paris, enabling its partners to join the environmental revolution and pursue more sustainable futures.
The team
The Strategy team evolves around ACT Group's corporate strategy
column2: exploring ways how ACT can grow into its next phase. We analyze the markets in which we operate: what drives them, how they are built, and who the key actors are. We find companies that match these needs and identify buy, build, or partnership opportunities for ACT.

column1: What you'll do

For this internship, we are looking for someone who will analyze the renewable energy market. You'll analyze the market drivers, pricing, trends, and other factors that influence these markets. Following this, you will be required to provide advice on where ACT can position itself in the market and provide strategic recommendations for ACT's growth. You will contribute to designing how ACT can stay impactful in the coming years, thereby working closely alongside the R&D team.
Who you are
We are looking for someone with professionalism at their core
column2: experience isn't required but helpful. It is important that you are self-motivated and able to take initiative, that you're eager to learn, and you're not afraid to fail and try again. In a nutshell you:

column1: Are fluent in English
Are available for at least 3 days per week over a 6-month period OR 5days a week for 3 months
Have recently completed a Master's degree or currently in a Master's degree program. Preferably in either Business, Economics, or a renewable energy related degree with a business angle
0-2 years of working/internship experience in and affinity with management/strategy consulting (MBB, big 4), environmental commodities or investment banking
Are an excellent communicator with great interpersonal skills
Have a knack for analytical thinking
Are not afraid to cold call and approach people
Are Energetic, intellectually curious, autonomous and ambitious
What we offer
Internship remuneration
Comprehensive training
Quarterly target incentive gifts
In-house life coach
And more!",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/1028585/act-commodities-squareLogo-1661858485216.png,Amsterdam,nan,ACT Commodities
Chief of Staff,"Eneco - Amsterdam
Senior
40 uur
Take a leading role to actively drive sustainability in the energy sector
Co-lead the digital transition for a 200-employee CDO organization, high impact
Grow your career as an experienced professional with potential for advancement
Why choose for Eneco?
What you’ll do

As Chief of Staff, you will support the CDO and his organization of ~200 employees in all the strategic initiatives. Work as the day-to-day, right hand to the CDO and you will attend meetings on behalf of the CDO and lead strategic planning processes across the organisation. You will play a key role overseeing various aspects of CDO activities, including presentations, interactions with colleagues and the leadership team, interactions with the board and other stakeholders. You will partner with him and his Leadership Team to define and drive the strategic CDO agenda and drive ambitious strategic initiatives across all areas of the business. You will act as an extension of the CDO in appropriate settings to oversee meetings or activities

This is not an administrative position-it is a highly strategic and facilitative role that requires a combination of focus and flexibility. You must enjoy working and collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to achieve buy-in and drive organization-wide impact.
Is this about you?
7+ years in investment banking, consulting, or similar, ideally in a growth start-up environment
Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills with exposure to senior partners
Hands-on experience with strategic projects in a complex stakeholder landscape
Demonstrated strong record of problem-solving and analytical skills in challenging situations
Master's degree in economics/business or computer science/engineering, PhD is a plus
You’ll be responsible for
Participate in engagements with senior stakeholders
Engage with the PMO to define and ensure project management standards
Provide administrative, financial, and operational support to the CDO
Lead the preparation process for various analyses and presentations
Build strong relationships with other departments to support cross-functional partnerships
This is where you’ll work

At Eneco, you will find a unique combination of time, place, and opportunity. We are on a mission to be climate neutral before 2035 and work hard to keep global warming under 1.5 °C. Our employees are motivated to reduce carbon, together with our large base of customers. And technology is ready to bring climate neutral, scalable energy solutions to homes and businesses. This is extremely fertile ground for digital innovation. Do you want to apply your digital skills and talent to help build a zero-emission future?

Our Digital team is vital to making our One Planet Plan and the accelerated energy transition a reality. Working closely with the business and ICT, our Product, Data Science, and Data Engineering community bring the skills and mindset to make Eneco Europe's leading digital first and climate neutral energy company.
What we have to offer
Gross year salary of
between and
Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.
FlexBudget on top of
your gross salary
Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth
Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office
You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
Working at Eneco is for everyone

Our customers are diverse, and so are we. More than 3,000 Eneco-talents ensure an open, pleasant culture in which everyone can grow and thrive. In this way we create the ideal situation for creative insights and innovative solutions. And we can use that to achieve our ambitious mission: to be climate neutral by 2035. You know what the fun is? We can never have enough talent at Eneco. So get in touch and apply.
Together towards climate neutrality

Ask a colleague about our joint mission and you will hear it again and again: Eneco wants to be climate neutral by 2035. Everyone works together to realize this ambition. We help customers switch to sustainable energy with good advice and smart, affordable products. We develop wind farms, install large solar roofs and invest in heat networks. We see opportunities everywhere. Are you in?
This is how the application procedure goes
Stap 1
Your application
Stap 2
We carefully review your application
Stap 3
We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4
Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5
Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
For more information about the application procedure, call our Recruiter Olivier, via +31623488668
Apply immediately? That is also possible, through our recruitment system. Click on the button below and send your resume with English motivation. You will receive a response as soon as possible.
An employment screening is part of the selection procedure.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/39340/eneco-holding-squarelogo-1426664326383.png,Amsterdam,nan,Eneco

Job Description:
General information:

As a result of dynamic growth of our organization we are currently looking for candidates for the position SCADA Project Engineer. Open-minded, customer oriented & innovative are key-factors for success in our working environment. You should be a team player who collaborates across organizational levels in an intercultural environment.

Build station control systems (SCADA) for high and medium voltage switchgears according to the newest technology standard IEC 61850. Support the project manager in technical matters and coordinate both customers and internal partners. Prepare operation manuals that are based on our customer's requirements. Your background:

Good knowledge of Dutch and English is required. Chief of Staff - Maternity Cover,"Become part of a European leader in fast charging and play a fundamental role in shaping our future towards sustainable mobility! Together with more than 170 colleagues from 35 nationalities, we enable electric vehicle drivers around Europe to fast-charge their vehicle with 100% renewable energy and lead the way in making mobility sustainable. We have recently been voted best charging network in the UK, in France and the Netherlands, which is a testimony to our drive to offer the best charging experience to EV drivers. Fastned is a fast growing, Euronext listed scaleup company.

This role can be either a maternity cover for around 7 months - a great stepping stone for other functions within Fastned - or an indefinite role right away as Internal Management Consultant (see our career page for other role).

We are looking for a Chief of Staff, who will serve as the right-hand to the CEO. As a strategist, consultant, and doer, you will ensure streamlined activities within Fastned based on the priorities of our CEO. As a member of our leadership team, you will be actively driving important projects, be an important element to our strategy development and enable effective communication between all stakeholders, such as the Supervisory Board, the Board of Directors, the Executive Team and management.

As our Chief of Staff you keep a pulse on the business and help connect the dots. You will handle portions of the day-to-day tasks that rest with the Board of the company and will keep the CEO on track. You make sure that strategic decisions are being executed by channeling, analysing and assimilating input from different stakeholders into effective business plans. You will support overseeing large, often cross-functional & organisation-wide projects, while monitoring and improving the information flow with key stakeholders. Sometimes you will act as a gatekeeper, ensuring our CEOs involvement in a project or decision-making process at the right moment.

In order to be effective in this high impact role you are a skilled relationship manager who can quickly integrate into our organization and build strong working relationships with those reporting to the CEO and others across the organisation. This diverse and fast-paced job requires excellent communication, strong analytical skills, a tolerance for ambiguity, high levels of organisation, and a can-do attitude, in which tasks both big and small are taken on with enthusiasm. You are willing to engage in high-level strategic discussions one day and to prepare presentation materials and other documentation the next. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a fast-growing organization, we encourage you to apply for this position.
Job requirements

We are looking for someone with curiosity and brains to very quickly gain a deep understanding of our business and who is able to combine this with diplomacy to communicate about findings and improvements in an effective manner. You know how to define strategies and put them into action while being in an advisory role. Furthermore, you have the ability to think on your own feet - you feel comfortable taking ownership.
Additionally, you tick the following boxes:
Able to start beginning of May 2023 at the latest
4-6 years of previous experience in strategy consulting or a similar role within a scale-up or fast-paced business environment
Masters degree in business (e.g., MBA) or from a technical university
Outstanding organisational skills and a proven track-record of successful project management
Excellent document drafting skills and advanced knowledge of Powerpoint/Keynote and Microsoft Excel
Outstanding spoken and written language skills in English (Dutch is a plus not a must)
You are highly motivated by accelerating the energy transition.
Join us in building a better future

We work hard to change the world, but we don't forget to celebrate our successes, big and small. Our benefits include a pension plan (fully covered by Fastned) and participation in the company stock options program. We provide daily vegetarian lunches & the best coffee at our Amsterdam headquarters close to the Amstel station. In order to feel & enjoy the EV life you get access to our fully electric vehicle fleet (all charging expenses covered). Next to fun company events year-round, we organise an amazing yearly trip abroad. Other perks include flexible working hours, full travel compensation and the gear of your choice (MacBook vs Dell XPS, iPhone vs Android).

Fastned currently operates in six countries (Netherlands, Germany, UK, Switzerland, France and Belgium) and is growing fast. As a young, independent company with a flat organization structure, we give a lot of responsibility to our new hires and expect you to think for yourself.
Interested?
We would love to have a conversation with you! Apply now, send us your CV and explain in your motivation letter why you’re excited about joining our mission.
The recruitment process consists of 3 stages:
A first video call with one of our recruiters to find out more about Fastned & our company culture
An interview with our Chief of Staff to deep dive into the role
A case-assignment and on-site presentation to the CEO, Head of Legal and Location Design Director.

Fastned stands for equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, gender identities, sexual orientations, religions, neurodiversity, disabilities, parental status or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/3073766/fastned-squarelogo-1604068814841.png,Netherlands,nan,Fastned Charging
Asset Management Data Steward,"Asset Management Data Steward
Rotterdam
Maintenance & Engineering
40 uur
Beschrijving van
deze vacature
Asset Management Data Steward

As an Asset Management Data Steward, you will be responsible for optimizing, expanding and creating new practices that will improve the quality of the Asset Management Data in the digital landscape across functional areas. You will implement data governance policies including master data management, data quality processes, data standards
column2: and subsequently monitor data availability/consistency and compliance against these policies. When deviations from policy are detected, and not resolved through automated means, you will be the focal point for issue resolution.

column1: You will become part of the Asset Management team and work together with key stakeholders across terminals and regions, and also with global data architects, BPAs, peer data stewards, data engineers.
About Vopak

Vopak is well underway to become a digital and data driven organization. We have been standardizing the business processes across our terminal network and modernizing our application landscape. For this purpose, we have invested significantly in the data infrastructure foundation and data management program to utilize the value added digital information to help improve our customer service
column3: reduce our costs, energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions
column4: and share our data with partners in the logical supply chain.

column1: Do you want to accept the challenge and join us in the journey through the energy transition and making our organization more data driven? If you believe this can be done with high quality data and if you are ready to take up the challenge to improve the quality of data, then this role is for you!
Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities
Manage data quality requirements
Assess the current state of data quality, security, privacy and retention
Set target goals for data quality and adherence with all other types of data governance policies
Monitor and track ongoing data quality levels and other metrics that assess the adherence of data and people to data governance policies.
Identify and implement optimal approaches for resolving data quality issues to achieve targets
Pro-actively analyze and correct data quality issues that cannot be addressed fully by automated means.
Report periodically to the data owner and data governance board about data quality, and provide input for improvements in the work of data quality, governance and stewardship
Participate in regular stewards council meetings
Responsibilities
Preferably 3+ years of experience in a data stewardship and governance, data analysis techniques, data quality tooling and data catalogs
Preferably experience in “asset management” domain and “maintain to operate” business process
Understanding of how data is used across business processes and its impact on desired business results
Awareness of the quality, security, and privacy requirements related to asset management & other overlapping business functions
Bachelor’s degree
Hands on SQL knowledge, strong written and verbal English communication skills
Skills related to data analytics, problem solving and conflict resolution working in a multicultural environment
We Offer
Every career at Vopak is given the opportunity to shine. When you join Vopak, you can count on:
A challenging position with a high degree of responsibility in a 400 years old Dutch multinational
Highly motivated colleagues
Growth through personal development opportunities at national and international level
Participation in private pension fund Vopak and collective health
Are you the Asset Management Data Steward we are Looking for?

If yes, then start your journey at Vopak and click on the ‘apply’ button below. For more information about the vacancy, please contact Syed Atiquddin Qadri (Director Asset Management).",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/10494/royal-vopak-squarelogo.png,Rotterdam,nan,Vopak
Business IT Demand Architect Business Unit (BU) Heat NL,"About the job
Do you want to shape the fossil free future?

Vattenfall Business Area (BA) Heat is now looking for the right person to fill the position as Business IT Demand Architect for BU Heat NL. You will be part of the IT and Digital Services team (TD-I). In this position you will play a crucial role in the digital transformation that BA Heat is undergoing.

BA Heat must prepare for disruption driven by external exponential technologies (e.g. Cloud, Artificial Intelligence and Analytics), while maintaining reliable service supporting new energy provisioning models, both enabled and challenged by digitalization.
Therefore Information Technology (IT) is the enabling component for our digital transformation.
Our team is enabling the organization to explore and deploy new business opportunities while translating technology into business value.
We are looking for an Business IT Demand Architect covering the BU Heat NL scope.

BU Heat NL consists of two divisions with over 1000 employees: Heat Customers & Grid, and Production. These two divisions come together to provide production, management of our heating networks and delivery of heating to clients, thus combining our forces in the Netherlands to realise our growth strategy in the area of heating for customers and so contribute to the transition towards sustainable energy supply with our units.
You will play a pivotal role in translating the digital strategy into tangible, future proof and practical designs, combining processes, data and systems.
As Business IT Demand Architect BU Heat NL you are responsible to
Build the bridge between innovation and existing business by advising and implementing platform strategies and (partner) eco systems
Follow trends and connect them to (digital) roadmap
Support the Digital Transformation leaders in translating (digital) roadmap into architecture transition stages
Drive customer value by advising and applying new technologies
Translate customer vision in architecture patterns for data, content, social, channels.
Increase velocity of agile teams by proactive guidance based on reference architecture and design patterns
Pre analysis of selected business initiatives
Your profile
You have the following key tasks
Co-develop and maintain:
BA Heat architecture strategy
Business driven target architectures
Transition roadmaps and guide projects accordingly
Define architecture patterns to guide agile teams and waterfall projects
Drive innovation and simplification of IT Architecture
Application Asset Management: Maintenance of up-to-date application inventory relevant for BA Heat in the EAM tool.
Efficient and effective cooperation with business stakeholders and IT Architects and
Translate technology developments into business improvement proposals
Your qualifications

We are looking for a person who has a relevant University degree Computer Science, Information Management, Enterprise Automation or related field. In addition, the following qualifications are important for this position:
Proven skills in driving a Digital transformation from a business architectural point of view
Experience in dealing with strategic, highly complex issues, problems and challenges in changing context
Holistic and visionary view to identify future trends and opportunities
Experienced at working in international cross-functional teams and dealing with higher management
Proven interpersonal skills in successfully driving value creation in cooperation with Staff function IT
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a business architectural role
Your personal characteristics
Excellent communication and presentation skills to explain complex topics in an understandable way to higher and middle management
Stress resistant and able to prioritize and focus
Good analytical skills
Strong Team player with excellent cooperation skills dealing with different cultures in an international setting
Consulting skills to advise your stakeholders on the way forward.
Good sense of humor
Willingness to travel
Self-motivated and you like to work pro-actively
Your command of English is strong, both verbally and in writing
Additional information
What we offer
A market-level salary and competitive benefits package, including the option to purchase additional holidays, discounts on Vattenfall products and a supplement to your pension.

At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable efficient and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, and ethnic and cultural backgrounds. We believe in work life balance and the flexibility to work from home.
How to apply
We are looking forward to your application! Please provide us with a short CV and cover letter. Any upfront questions will be answered by the hiring manager, Erik Burow (+49 172 324 5291).
For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Valentijn Berkien: valentijn.berkien@vattenfall.com
Looking forward to your application! We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
About the company

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/10580/vattenfall-squarelogo-1531439516807.png,Amsterdam,nan,Vattenfall

Business Consultant,"Enexis Netbeheer, onderdeel van Enexis Groep, voorziet ruim 3 miljoen huishoudens en bedrijven in Nederland van elektriciteit en gas. Je komt bij ons binnen op een interessant moment. De energietransitie is namelijk in volle gang en dat merk je in elke vezel van onze organisatie. Slim onderhoud, energie terugleveren, aardgasvrij wonen, windenergie opwekken en ga zo nog maar even door, we werken er hard aan om het mogelijk te maken. Dat leidt tot allerlei processen waar jij een waardevolle bijdrage aan kunt leveren.

Je gaat als Business Consultant werken in het ketenteam van een onze vier procesketens: Onderhoud en Storingen, Grootverbruik & Netten en Kleinverbruik. Binnen je ketenteam opereer je landelijk en werk je samen met productmanagers, senior consultants en andere business consultants. Reken maar vast op een betrokken club collega's en veel vrijheid. Zo bieden we voor thuiswerken bijvoorbeeld alle ruimte.
Functiebeschrijving

Als Business Consultant bij Enexis help je éen van de grote Nederlandse netbeheerders bedrijfsprocessen optimaal in te richten. Dat begint met uitzoeken van wat nou precies optimaal is. Daarvoor heb je contact met mensen uit alle geledingen van onze organisatie. Je verdiept je in de belangen van klanten, medewerkers en de organisatie, maar ook in de kaders door wet- en regelgeving en de ruimte die innovatieve automatiseringsmogelijkheden kunnen bieden. Zo kom je tot heldere procesontwerpen en -adviezen die naadloos aansluiten bij onze bedrijfsstrategie.

Vervolgens begeleid je projectteams bij het SAFe agile realiseren van procesverbeteringen, op basis van de veranderagenda die je opstelt. Bijvoorbeeld door het ontwikkelen van apps. Als een visionaire bruggenbouwer zorg je zo voor verandering en vooruitgang, zodat we als organisatie de uitdagingen van de energietransitie aankunnen.

Belangrijk in deze functie is vooral dat je niet alleen scherp krijgt waaraan nù behoefte is, maar ook over een paar jaar. Je grootste uitdaging wordt ongetwijfeld prioriteren. Door de energietransitie groeit ons werkpakket namelijk gestaag en ondertussen verandert ook nog onze rol als netbeheerder. Over uitdagingen gesproken. Durf jij ‘m aan?
Functie-eisen

Een rasechte verbinder met een resultaatgerichte aanpak en een verfrissende blik. Op inspirerende wijze zorg je voor draagvlak. Ze help je hele teams stap na stap te maken. Je voelt je thuis in een technische organisatie als de onze en verstaat de kunst op tijd afstand te nemen om in ons bedrijfsbelang te kunnen blijven handelen. Daarbij altijd rekening houdend met wat een verandering betekent voor onze organisatie, processen en systemen.
Verder heb jij:
minimaal een hbo-diploma (bijvoorbeeld bedrijfskunde)
ervaring met het begeleiden en coördineren van verandertrajecten
affiniteit met softwareontwikkeling
kennis van en ervaring met procesmanagement, projectmatig werken en procesontwerpmethodieken (zoals lean, SAFe en agile werken).
Let op: vanwege onze veiligheidsvoorschriften is het bij al onze functies verplicht om Nederlands taalniveau C1 te lezen, te spreken en te schrijven.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
In ruil voor jouw energie zorgt Enexis goed voor je. Dit mag je verwachten:

Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de € 3.854,- en € 7.308,- op basis van 40 uur per week. Dit is inclusief 10% persoonlijk budget en 10,7% dertiende maand. Je kunt deze budgetten flexibel inzetten, bijvoorbeeld voor extra verlofdagen.8% vakantiegeld over je brutojaarsalaris.We dragen 70% bij aan je ABP Keuzepensioen.De mogelijkheid om je werkweek flexibel in te delen. We vinden een goede balans tussen werk en privé namelijk belangrijk. Dus als je 's ochtends eerst de kinderen naar school wilt brengen of nog een rondje sportschool wilt doen, helemaal prima.Een jaarlijks vitaliteitsbudget van € 500,-. Bijvoorbeeld voor een sportabonnement of advies van een voedingscoach.Een kilometervergoeding en een mobiliteitskaart met een ov-abonnement 1e klas.Alle ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Dat is voor ons namelijk een topprioriteit. Dus wil je een opleiding of cursus volgen, dan is de kans groot dat we de kosten voor onze rekening nemen.
Zijn wij een match?

We investeren graag in duurzame relaties. Om zeker te zijn van een goede match, voeren we daarom een screening uit. Deze verschilt per functie en kan bestaan uit: een assessment en het opvragen van referenties en een verklaring omtrent het gedrag (VOG). Tijdens je sollicitatiegesprek vertellen we je precies waar de screening in jouw geval uit bestaat.
Sollicitatieprocedure

Interesse? Solliciteer direct via de solliciteerbutton en je ontvangt meer informatie over de verdere procedure. Vragen? Neem gerust contact op met Nadia van de Pol (Corporate Recruiter)",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/987154/enexis-squarelogo-1512548144057.png,Den Bosch,€4K - €7K (Employer est.),Enexis

THE HAGUE-BORDEWIJKLAAN 18(NLD)
Netherlands
Job Description

As Contracts and Procurement Methods Engineer, your missions will be:

TotalEnergies is a broad energy company that produces and markets fuels, natural gas and electricity. Contracts Engineer,"To stay ahead of the industry, we are developing tomorrow’s technology today, transforming bold ideas into state-of-the-art solutions to meet the market’s ever changing needs. Do you trust your own vision, dare to do things that have not been done before and have the courage to pursue it? Then join the thinkers, leaders and visionaries at Allseas!
We are currently looking for a Contracts Engineer Subcontracting to join our team in Delft, the Netherlands.

The Contracts Engineer Subcontracting will complement the commercial and capital (sub) contracts team, which is a separate unit within procurement function. The team is engaged in the development of a pool of relevant suppliers, and contracting for commercial and capital projects.

Allseas commercial projects are centred around subsea installation work, topside and jacket installation and removal work. Historically most work is oil and gas related and recently Allseas has been awarded work in renewables as well.
Driven by the Allseas ambition to remain a sustained frontrunner in the offshore industry our capital projects entail the successful incorporation of contracted work in these projects.
Wherever possible, the contracts engineer will contribute to continuous improvement of the relevant procurement processes, while embracing a supply chain management vision.
Your role

In this role, your general responsibilities will be to support and actively participate in the continuous improvement of Allseas’ management system within the scope of the job, to promote a safe and healthy working environment for Allseas employees and contractors working in Allseas premises and to present Allseas as an attractive and reliable business partner and maintain long-term relationships with subcontractors and suppliers.
Job specific tasks
Perform the tendering and contracting process as assigned by the Team Lead Procurement Contracts, in line with approved procedures
Liaise with internal clients to compile requirements for the scope and/or sourcing of goods, materials and/or services
Define the contracting strategy based on value/risk for Allseas and supply risk, market situations and internal policies and requirements
Select suppliers and conduct pre-qualifications and evaluation of potential suppliers
Coordinate – Prepare - Submit tender packages including draft frame agreement/contract to selected suppliers
Prepare bid-evaluation sheets for internal review and approval
Negotiate Terms and Conditions and pricing with vendors in liaison with the Legal Department
Award frame agreement/ contract
Administrate the frame agreement/contract in Oracle for automatic generation of Purchase Orders
What we expect from you
BSc or MSc degree in Business Administration, Commercial Law, Engineering, Technical Science or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5 years’ contracting or tactical procurement experience
General (technical) knowledge of industry practices
Excellent negotiation skills
Excellent analytical skills
The ability to create and maintain good working relationships with internal stakeholders (technical Department and vessel crew)
Good knowledge of the English and Dutch languages, both written and spoken
Results driven, common sense and hands-on mentality
Knowledge of ERP and MS Office systems/applications
NEVI 1&2, CIPS, IFPPM or equivalent courses are considered an advantage
What we offer you
Working at Allseas allows you the chance to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, with creative thinking, collaboration and down-to-earth culture at its core.
You can expect
competitive industry benchmarked salary and excellent pension
performance based salary raises and bonuses
30 holidays days per year, flexible working hours
extensive training and development programme, study budgets and coaching
a company-sponsored fitness scheme
internal clubs, committees, parties and (sportive) events
Interested?
If you feel that you can contribute to our business by diving into this exciting opportunity, we are looking forward to receiving your CV and motivational letter! Please apply via the ‘Apply’ button.
An online personality questionnaire can be part of the selection procedure.
In our application procedure, you can read what to expect when you apply for a job at Allseas.",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/679078/allseas-group-squarelogo-1426668342682.png,Delft,nan,Allseas

Chief of Staff - Maternity Cover,"Become part of a European leader in fast charging and play a fundamental role in shaping our future towards sustainable mobility! Together with more than 170 colleagues from 35 nationalities, we enable electric vehicle drivers around Europe to fast-charge their vehicle with 100% renewable energy and lead the way in making mobility sustainable. We have recently been voted best charging network in the UK, in France and the Netherlands, which is a testimony to our drive to offer the best charging experience to EV drivers. Fastned is a fast growing, Euronext listed scaleup company._This role can be either a maternity cover for around 7 months - a great stepping stone for other functions within Fastned - or an indefinite role right away as Internal Management Consultant (see our career page for other role)._We are looking for a Chief of Staff, who will serve as the right-hand to the CEO. As a strategist, consultant, and doer, you will ensure streamlined activities within Fastned based on the priorities of our CEO. As a member of our leadership team, you will be actively driving important projects, be an important element to our strategy development and enable effective communication between all stakeholders, such as the Supervisory Board, the Board of Directors, the Executive Team and management.As our Chief of Staff you keep a pulse on the business and help connect the dots. You will handle portions of the day-to-day tasks that rest with the Board of the company and will keep the CEO on track. You make sure that strategic decisions are being executed by channeling, analysing and assimilating input from different stakeholders into effective business plans. You will support overseeing large, often cross-functional & organisation-wide projects, while monitoring and improving the information flow with key stakeholders. Sometimes you will act as a gatekeeper, ensuring our CEOs involvement in a project or decision-making process at the right moment.In order to be effective in this high impact role you are a skilled relationship manager who can quickly integrate into our organization and build strong working relationships with those reporting to the CEO and others across the organisation. This diverse and fast-paced job requires excellent communication, strong analytical skills, a tolerance for ambiguity, high levels of organisation, and a can-do attitude, in which tasks both big and small are taken on with enthusiasm. You are willing to engage in high-level strategic discussions one day and to prepare presentation materials and other documentation the next. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a fast-growing organization, we encourage you to apply for this position.*Job requirements*We are looking for someone with curiosity and brains to very quickly gain a deep understanding of our business and who is able to combine this with diplomacy to communicate about findings and improvements in an effective manner. You know how to define strategies and put them into action while being in an advisory role. Furthermore, you have the ability to think on your own feet - you feel comfortable taking ownership.Additionally, you tick the following boxes:Able to start beginning of May 2023 at the latest
column2: 4-6 years of previous experience in strategy consulting or a similar role within a scale-up or fast-paced business environment
column3: Masters degree in business (e.g., MBA) or from a technical university
column4: Outstanding organisational skills and a proven track-record of successful project management
column5: Excellent document drafting skills and advanced knowledge of Powerpoint/Keynote and Microsoft Excel
column6: Outstanding spoken and written language skills in English (Dutch is a plus not a must)
column7: You are highly motivated by accelerating the energy transition.Join us in building a better futureWe work hard to change the world, but we don't forget to celebrate our successes, big and small. Our benefits include a pension plan (fully covered by Fastned) and participation in the company stock options program. We provide daily vegetarian lunches & the best coffee at our Amsterdam headquarters close to the Amstel station. In order to feel & enjoy the EV life you get access to our fully electric vehicle fleet (all charging expenses covered). Next to fun company events year-round, we organise an amazing yearly trip abroad. Other perks include flexible working hours, full travel compensation and the gear of your choice (MacBook vs Dell XPS, iPhone vs Android).Fastned currently operates in six countries (Netherlands, Germany, UK, Switzerland, France and Belgium) and is growing fast. As a young, independent company with a flat organization structure, we give a lot of responsibility to our new hires and expect you to think for yourself.Interested?We would love to have a conversation with you! Apply now, send us your CV and explain in your motivation letter why you’re excited about joining our mission.The recruitment process consists of 3 stages:A first video call with one of our recruiters to find out more about Fastned & our company culture
column8: An interview with our Chief of Staff to deep dive into the role
column9: A case-assignment and on-site presentation to the CEO, Head of Legal and Location Design Director._Fastned stands for equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, gender identities, sexual orientations, religions, neurodiversity, disabilities, parental status or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique._",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/3073766/fastned-squarelogo-1604068814841.png,Amsterdam,nan,Fastned

column1: Product Manager Werkplekomgeving,"Werk waar je trots op kan zijn
Dit ga je doen

De energievoorziening is volop in verandering. Energiebronnen verduurzamen, het energiespeelveld vernieuwd en ook de vraag en aanbod is anders dan het ooit geweest is. Kortom, het veilig en betrouwbaar beheren van onze energie infrastructuur is meer en meer afhankelijk van digitalisering. Dit betekent dat we van een traditionele Netbeheerder een ‘High Performance Digital Organisation’ (HPDO) aan het worden zijn. IT speelt daar een cruciale en zelfs leidende rol in. In de verdere digitalisering wordt het sneller leveren van business waarde steeds belangrijker. Daarom werken we bij Stedin IT in Agile teams (BusDevOps) en volgens het Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) waarbij we resultaat verantwoordelijkheid hoog in het vaandel hebben.

Om deze reden willen wij graag een Product Manager Werkplekomgeving toevoegen aan het team. Want een goed presterende ICT-werkomgeving bevat niet alleen stabiel functionerende secure laptops, toughbooks, tablets en smartphone, maar ook goed toegankelijke Office365 producten. MS Teams en MS SharePoint zijn al niet meer weg te denken, maar er zit nog meer potentie in. En we innoveren verder, daarom moeten we ook de werkplek verder door ontwikkelen. Bijvoorbeeld omdat De Hololens (VR-bril) die zijn intrede doet. Als Product Manager vind je al deze techniek natuurlijk super interessant en ken je de mogelijkheden. Je signaleert kansen en ontwikkelingen, en verzamelt en vertaald wensen vanuit de markt en klant naar product eisen.

Waar het echt om gaat is een goede Employee Experience en dat onze ICT-werkomgeving onze gebruikers optimaal ondersteunen in hun werk. Of dit nu op kantoor, thuis of de monteur in de straat is. Ook het stimuleren en mogelijk maken van samenwerkingen, binnen en buiten de organisatie op een veilige wijze, wordt een speerpunt van de ICT-werkomgeving. Daarom zoek je als Productmanager Werkplekomgeving steeds meer de verbinding met de initiatieven vanuit HR, Facilities en de Operatie. Door middel van gesprekken met stakeholders van de business weet jij volgens ons Epic proces de vertaling te maken van business wensen naar Epics. En in samenwerking met de Product Owner in het team draag je zorg voor de vertaling van business-level user stories naar duidelijke features en user-stories voor het dev-team.

Als Product Manager Werkplekomgeving leidt je samen met de Release Train Engineer en Solution Architect de Agile BusDevOps Trein Werkomgeving bestaande uit 6 teams. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen en realiseren van de product visie, scorecard en roadmaps van de ICT Werkomgeving. Je zorgt voor alignment van interne stakeholders rond de product visie en werkt hiervoor nauw samen met 6 Product Owners. Tenslotte ben je bezig met het opbouwen van een goede relatie met de leveranciers.
Jouw toegevoegde waarde als Product Manager Werkplekomgeving?

Het is de taak van de Product Manager om in een dynamische omgeving met verschillende stakeholders toegevoegde waarde te leveren rondom de werkplek. Je raakt dus alle medewerkers, van kantoormedewerkers tot monteurs. Jij bent een persoon die een visie heeft op de werkplek in al zijn facetten en hier strategische lijnen voor uit kan zetten. Door een goed overzicht te houden op klant- en businesswaarde en te evalueren of de toegevoegde waarde gerealiseerd wordt zoals gepland, blijf je de impact monitoren. Verder heb je strategisch inzicht, ga je planmatig te werk, sta je stevig in jouw schoenen, laat je je niet zomaar uit het veld slaan en weet je hoe je draagvlak kan creëren in de organisatie. Goed stakeholdermanagement is cruciaal en gaat je ook gemakkelijk af! Een natuurlijke teamspeler, met een sterke staat van dienst van multidisciplinair leiderschap, coaching van medewerkers en projectmanagement skills
Jouw sterke punten
Worden we blij van

Hierin werk je nauw samen in een SAFe omgeving met de Release Train Engineer, Solution Architect en 6 Product Owners. Je bent bezig met het in kaart brengen van afdeling-overstijgende samenwerkingsmogelijkheden, afhankelijkheden en risico’s. Je denkt en handelt strategisch, hebt snel een overzicht over het speelveld en (door)ziet de belangen van de spelers. Je hebt een toonaangevende en vernieuwende visie en bent gewend hier draagvlak voor te creëren. Je bent een inspirator voor het realiseren van veranderingen in teams en treinen.
Wat jou verder onze Product Manager Werkplekomgeving maakt?

Je hebt minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in een relevante richting zoals informatietechnologie / informatica / bedrijfskunde / bedrijfseconomie of vergelijkbaar of -indien geen wo-opleiding- een bewezen trackrecord in een soortgelijke functie.
Je hebt ervaring met Leveranciersmanagement.
Je hebt je SAFe PM certificaat of bent gemotiveerd om je als SAFe PM te certificeren.
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als PO/PM in een Safe omgeving.
Jij kunt adviseren op tactisch en strategisch niveau en beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je zet je organisatiesensitiviteit in en weet stakeholders te overtuigen en enthousiasmeren.
Voldoe je (nog) niet aan alle functie eisen, maar denk je dat jij de juiste kandidaat bent? Dan zijn we ook benieuwd naar je en nodigen we je graag uit te solliciteren!
Goed om te weten: Bij Stedin hebben we genoeg te doen. Daarom is deze rol voor minimaal 32 uur beschikbaar. Nog meer uit je rol halen? 40 uur werken kan natuurlijk ook
Bekijk Onze
arbeidsvoorwaarden
Elke maand je Persoonlijk Budget kiezen

Het Persoonlijk Budget is een percentage van je bruto maandsalaris en ontvang je bovenop je salaris. Afhankelijk van je salarisschaal is dat tot 24% van je brutosalaris, inclusief 8% vakantiegeld. Je bepaalt zelf waaraan je het Persoonlijk Budget wilt besteden. Zo kun je het uit laten keren voor een maandelijks extraatje. Of je koopt extra verlofdagen.
Flexibele werktijden

Wil je zelf je werkweek indelen? Samen met je leidinggevende bepaal jij zo veel mogelijk je eigen werktijden. We werken 8 uur per dag. Afhankelijk van je werkzaamheden, heb je de mogelijkheid om, wanneer het kan, thuis te werken.
Vervoer

We zijn een duurzaam bedrijf. Reis je met het OV naar je werk, dan krijg je van ons een OV Vrij-abonnement 2e klas. Dit abonnement mag je ook privé gebruiken. Kies je voor een vaste reiskostenvergoeding dan ontvang je 13 cent per kilometer (maximaal 60 kilometer enkele reis) voor de dagen dat je reist voor je werk. Met je Persoonlijk Budget kun je dit aanvullen tot 21 cent netto per kilometer. Krijg je je eigen bedrijfsauto of -bus, dan mag je deze ook gebruiken voor woon-werkverkeer. Voor zakelijk verkeer gebruiken we deelauto’s.
Een goed team
Daar hoor je bij
Meteen vanaf dag één maak je deel uit van de ‘Werkplek Trein’. Jouw team bestaat uit 6 collega Product Owners.

We werken volgens ons Stedin@Work concept. Je werkt ongeveer de helft van de tijd primair op ons mooie kantoor, pal tegenover station Rotterdam Blaak, de plek waar jij je collega’s ontmoet. Hier heb je ook de beschikking over een fantastisch uitzicht, een bedrijfsrestaurant op de 18e verdieping! De andere helft van de tijd werk je thuis. Wel zo flexibel. Natuurlijk zorgen wij voor de juiste voorzieningen voor je thuiswerkplek.
Mooie arbeidsvoorwaarden
Die wil je hebben
Wij verwachten veel van jou, maar jij mag ook veel van ons verwachten. Wat je krijgt? Dat zie je hier.
Alle financiële arbeidsvoorwaarden op een rij, weet je meteen waar je aan toe bent:
Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden horen erbij. Zo krijg je een (maximaal) salaris van € 6.800 o.b.v. 40 uur per week en kennis en ervaring, 24,5 vakantiedagen en bouw je prima pensioen op bij het ABP.

Boven op je salaris ontvang je een persoonlijk budget van 24% (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld). Jij kiest zelf elke maand wat je met het budget doet. Elke maand extra salaris? (zo kun je ook € 7.888 per maand inclusief 16% Persoonlijk Budget verdienen)? Of misschien meer verlofdagen?

Gezonde energie, die heb je nodig. Daarom krijg je van ons ook een Duurzaam Inzetbaarheid budget van €500 bruto per jaar (bijvoorbeeld voor je sport abonnement, een hometrainer of je nieuwe sport outfit).

Volgens ons Stedin@Work concept werk je 50% thuis en 50% op kantoor, wel zo flexibel. Wij zorgen voor jouw thuiswerkfaciliteiten, een thuiswerkvergoeding en reizen naar kantoor doe je met je OV vrij-abonnement waarmee je ook buiten werk onbeperkt kan reizen!
Daar komt dit nog bovenop:
Werken bij Stedin betekent werken bij een World-class Workplace. Een van de trotspunten van onze (en jouw toekomstige) collega’s? Werksfeer.
Jouw ontwikkeling staat centraal: events bezoeken met collega’s, meedoen aan kennissessies, trainingen en opleidingen volgen. Zo geven we jouw talent écht alle kans en haal jij het beste uit jezelf.
Goede koffie van Heilige Boontjes.
Nu reageren

Risicomanager Grid Field Operations,"TenneT is hard groeiend om de onze ambities waar te kunnen maken. Zo nemen wij een leidende rol in het aanjagen van de energietransitie. Het werven van nieuw talent speelt daarin een cruciale rol. Wij zijn op zoek naar een gedreven Risicomanager voor onze Gridfield Operations op onze locatie in Arnhem. Ben jij degene die hieraan wil bijdragen?
Jouw bijdrage aan TenneT
In de rol van Risicomanager binnen Grid Field Operations Nederland ga je het volgende doen:

Je organiseert en faciliteert periodieke risicosessies en evalueert en analyseert de daaruit voortvloeiende risico's. Je beoordeelt de gekwantificeerde financiële en tijd gerelateerde impact van deze risico's en helpt het projectteam bij het prioriteren van verschillende risicobeheersingsstrategieën.

Je bewaakt en analyseert de status van risico's en de voortgang van maatregelen en adviseert het projectmanagement over mogelijke vervolgacties. Je hebt een ondersteunende en adviserende rol richting de projectleiders bij het maken van belangrijke keuzes.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de opzet en het onderhoud van risicomanagementprocessen, beleid en procedures binnen het project, inclusief afstemming met betrokken partners.
Je legt de verbanden tussen de strategische, afdelings- en projectrisico's en levert input voor de rapportage en analyse van risico's op projectportfolio-niveau van TenneT.

Je neemt actief deel aan de activiteiten en ontwikkelingen binnen BGD-RC-RM, bestaande uit de project risk managers van alle onshore en offshore projecten binnen TenneT. Je draagt best practices aan en deelt kennis van nationale en internationale ontwikkelingen op het gebied van project risk management binnen grote infrastructurele projectenten. Ten einde input te leveren voor de verdere ontwikkeling van TenneT's project risk management beleid, verbeteringen door te voeren en zorg te dragen voor een uniforme implementatie hiervan.
Jouw profiel en achtergrond
Je hebt een afgeronde HBO opleiding in de richting van bedrijfskunde, economie, industrieel ingenieur of vergelijkbaar
Je hebt enkele jaren relevante werkervaring met een bewezen track record in risicomanagement, bij voorkeur binnen grote infrastructurele projecten
Je hebt coördinerende vaardigheden, net als deskundigheid op het gebied van communiceren, rapporteren en presenteren op verschillende niveaus in de organisatie
Je bent proactief, een teamspeler, een uitstekende netwerker en het levende voorbeeld voor eigenaarschap, verbinding en moed
Je vormt je eigen mening en staat open voor de mening van anderen

Persoonlijke ontwikkeling
Onze uitdaging

Business Guidance geeft advies voor strategische, operationele en financiële planning en prognoses. We stellen kritische vragen en we bewaken, analyseren en verbeteren de prestaties. Business Guidance waarborgt de financiële gezondheid van TenneT door middel van transparantie, het definiëren van (financiële) doelstellingen en het rapporteren over het bereiken van deze doelstellingen.
Extra informatie
De werktijd is 40 uur per week.
De positie is bepaalde onbepaalde tijd.

TenneT is een toonaangevende Europese netbeheerder (Transmission System Operator, TSO). Wij zetten ons in voor een veilige en betrouwbare elektriciteitsvoorziening, 24 uur per dag en 365 dagen per jaar. Daarbij stimuleren we de energietransitie met als doel een duurzame, betrouwbare en betaalbare energietoekomst. Als eerste grensoverschrijdende TSO ontwerpen, bouwen, onderhouden en exploiteren we 25.000 kilometer aan hoogspanningsverbindingen in Nederland en grote delen van Duitsland, en faciliteren we de Europese energiemarkt via de 17 interconnectoren met onze buurlanden. Met een omzet van 9,8 miljard euro en een totale activawaarde van 41 miljard euro zijn we een van de grootste investeerders in nationale en internationale elektriciteitsnetten, zowel onshore als offshore. Elke dag stellen onze 7.400 medewerkers alles in het werk om tegemoet te komen aan de behoeften van de samenleving door het tonen van eigenaarschap, moed en verbinding. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat meer dan 43 miljoen eindgebruikers op een stabiele elektriciteitsvoorziening kunnen rekenen.
Lighting the way ahead together

Senior Project Developer - Storage,"Senior Project Developer - Storage
Full-time
Company Description
Why Statkraft:

Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.
But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.
Job Description

We are currently looking for an experienced and enthusiastic (Senior) Project Developer - Storage to join our team in Statkraft Netherlands! Our offices in Netherlands are in Amsterdam and s-Hertogenbosch. We work on a “hybrid work” mode (home/office based) with regular travel within Netherlands and occasionally abroad for this position.

You will be part of the Storage team currently focused on developing battery storage. This encompasses both stand-alone utility scale battery storage as well as batteries co-located with our ground mounted solar PV projects and onshore wind projects in The Netherlands.
Your role:
Analysing the market for storage and contributing to the strategy for storage in the Netherlands
Identification of stand-alone utility scale battery storage projects, contributing to the development pipeline
Project development from site identification to permit
Manage the grid access through relationship with the various network operators
Coordinating site specifics with financial and technical colleagues and determine the consequences
Liaising with spatial planners and other advisers to prepare permit applications
Initiating and managing the permit application process towards province and municipality
Stakeholder management and community engagement
Pro-active contribution to the development of provincial and municipal vision and/or spatial planning
Track project level progress and risks. Provide insightful analysis and reporting to management
While you will drive the activities in the respective country you will be integrated into Statkraft’s wider team who will deliver financing, market and technical capabilities.
Qualifications
Master or Bachelor degree in business, economics, engineering, spatial planning or environmental and sustainability studies
Experience in the renewable energy industry
Prior experience in storage is considered an advantage
Knowledge of the Dutch renewable energy market
Highly proficient in MS Excel and other MS applications
Ability to manage numerous projects and relationships simultaneously including landowners, authorities, distribution network operators, advisors and internal stakeholders
Independent self-starter. Ability to manage a large workload, often providing support to processes managed by colleagues
Fluent in Dutch and English, any additional language is an advantage
Prepared to travel
Additional Information

A career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities, and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:
The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgrounds
A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principles

Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.
Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.

We evaluate applications for this role on a continuing basis, so please apply with your CV and cover letter through our career pages as soon as possible",https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/241449/statkraft-as-squarelogo-1466514031600.png,Amsterdam,nan,Statkraft
